2025 Bank of China M15 Hong Kongâ€”Week 2
In a final that was interrupted by rain several times, second-seeded Frenchman, Arthur Weber, converted 4 of 8 break points to defeat No. 7 seed Yuta Kawahashi 6-2 6-3 to capture his second title in as many weeks.
Entry-level Futures tournaments are crucial for aspiring professional tennis players because they provide a pathway to gain professional ranking points, compete against world-class players, and develop their game at a high level. This week saw teenagers Wong Tsz Fu and Kai Thompson both pick up their maiden ATP ranking point in singles.

Rambler Oasis Hotel
 Budget-friendly hotel na malapit sa HK Airport, Hongkong Disneyland, Ngong Ping 360 Cable Car at Shopping Mall (Citygate Outlets Mall).
Price rate per night: Php 2,000 to 3,000 plus
 Booked via Klook with promo code para may discount. Use Klook Code: ğ„ğƒğ™ğŠğ‹ğğğŠ for additional savings.
Book this hotel via Klook here 
https://www.klook.com/.../265125-rambler-oasis-hotel/...
 This room is Superior with 1 double bed, which is good enough for usâ€”2 adults and 1 child (2 years old).
 They have rooms that can accommodate a maximum of 3 adults and 2 children dahil may Triple Single Bed room sila, kaya perfect for families with kids. Kahit ilagay lang ang 3 adults and 1 child sa hotel booking dahil up to 0-12 years old and below can stay for free sa Rambler Oasis Hotel.
 May 500hkd security deposit. Refundable after check-out. 
 May free shuttle service from Rambler Oasis Hotel to Tsing Yi Station or Kwai Fong MTR Station. The seating of the hotel shuttle bus is under first-come-first-serve basis. (Check the last photo for more details.)
 May Wifi, Cabinet, Mini Ref, Electric Kettle, TV, Hair Blower, Towels, Toothbrush w/ Toothpaste, Slippers, Shampoo and Tea.
 Daily housekeeping, malinis ang room, at lobby maayos. Maganda yung view, malapit sa pier.
 Accessible ang hotel location to MTR Tsing Yi Station dahil may Mini Bus (88F) transport na walking distance lang. 
Mini Bus Fare: 4 hkd (One way)
 May malapit na 7/11, PARKnSHOP na grocery sa baba, Cafe de Coral, at Bank of China. May wifi sa lahat ng area.
 May plantsa na pwede i-request at ironing board.
 Pwede mag-iwan ng gamit before check in or after check out.
 Hotel review: https://vt.tiktok.com/ZSrMgB2wW/
 Guide from HK AirPort to Rambler Oasis Hotel via Bus: https://vt.tiktok.com/ZSrMgRtaL/

ã€#Racing Newsã€‘"Romantic Warrior" Undergoes First Fast Workout Post-Surgery in Preparation for Major Races

"Romantic Warrior," who sustained an injury after returning from a Middle Eastern campaign last season, has been gradually resuming training following surgery and a period of rest. The horse had previously resumed walking exercises and completed its first fast workout since the surgery yesterday.

Barring any unforeseen circumstances, trainer Danny Shum has indicated that "Romantic Warrior" will make its comeback in the BOCHK Jockey Club Cup (2000M, G2) in November. Following this, the horse will target the LONGINES Hong Kong Cup (2000M, G1), aiming to become the first four-time consecutive winner of this Grade 1 race.  Danny also expressed intentions to arrange another Middle Eastern campaign for the horse, though the final decision will depend on "Romantic Warrior's" recovery progress and performance after its return.

Thread Title: First ATP ranking point for Th
Post Message:
First ATP ranking point for Thompson, Wong

On Wednesday at the 2025 Bank of China M15 Hong Kongâ€”Week 2, teenagers Kai Thompson and Wong Tsz Fu both advanced to the second round to bag their first ATP ranking point. In the opening round, Thompson converted 4 of 8 break points to beat Dmitry Dolzhenkov 6-2 6-3, while Wong Tsz Fu also broke serve four times to beat Ty Host (AUS) 6-3 7-5.

Entry-level Futures are crucial for aspiring professional tennis players because they provide a pathway to gain professional ranking points. They get to compete against world-class players, develop their game at a high level, and ultimately earn entry into Challengers and ATP Tour events.

Musicus Society is celebrating our 15th anniversary this year! The highly anticipated Musicus Fest will begin on 1 November, featuring the English Chamber Orchestra and artists from Australia, Canada and Finland in collaboration with young local musicians in our annual celebration. Discover sweeping masterpieces and classic works in new arrangements, as well as with solo pieces that showcase dazzling virtuosity. 

ğŸƒğŸ‚ Festival Opening: Trey Lee & English Chamber Orchestra

. 
ğŸ» Festival Finale: The Devil and the Labyrinth 
Musicus Soloists Hong Kong partners with 2024 Joseph Joachim International Violin Competition laureates Angela Chan and Jacques Forestier, who will dazzle audiences with their superb skills, followed Vivaldiâ€™s charming violin and cello concerto and Beethovenâ€™s iconic â€œFateâ€ Symphony. 
.  
ğŸ•’ Harmonic Hour
Experience the sublime playing by the English Chamber Orchestra with your friendly concert host Franchesca Wong. An introductory concert interspersed with easy-to-follow demonstrations and featuring the talented Hoi Yan-lok as solo violist. 
. 
ğŸ† Next Generation Virtuosi
Catch rising star violist and 2025 Young Artist Audition winner Hoi Yan-lok in his Hong Kong recital debut at the start of a promising career. 
.  
ğŸ­ Family Concert: Marco Poloâ€™s Musical Encounter of East and West takes audiences aged 3+ on an interactive journey about music instruments, demonstrated by virtuoso musicians.

Thread Title: We are pleased to recognise th
Post Message:
We are pleased to recognise the achievements of Athena Yeung (Diocesan Girls' School) and Nicholas Cheng (Diocesan Boys' School), recipients of the BOCHK Bauhinia Bowl Outstanding Athletes Awards 2024-2025. 

Also, we would like to congratulate Athena Leung (Jockey Club Ti-I College) and Makson Chan (Lam Kam Fai Secondary School) for their outstanding success at the Grantham Outstanding Student Athletes Awards 2024-2025 (NT Region). 

We can't feel any prouder as their hard work, dedication and passion for tennis have always been pushing their own limit alongside systematic training! ğŸ’ªğŸ¾ Theyâ€™re living proof that with hard work and heart, greatness is just around the corner. Today (July 7), as members of the BNP delegation in its Education Trip in Laos, Center Director Prof. Linda Li and Research Fellow Dr. Man Luo visited two government ministries in Laos. The delegation had productive discussions with the Deputy Minister and other senior officials at the Ministry of Education and Sports, sharing insights about Hong Kong's education system and exploring the challenges and opportunities in Laos' education sector, as well as potential areas for educational cooperation between Hong Kong and Laos. At the Ministry of Culture and Tourism, they learned about Laos' tourism resources and related policies and measures to develop and promote tourism as an industry. 

They also visited the Confucius Institute, National University of Laos, where Director Li Jianmin briefed them on Laos' culture and Chinese language education at the Institute. They also heard a presentation from the President of Laosâ€™ Diplomatic Club about the history of America's Secret War in Laos.

Subsequently, they visited the Bank of China Vientiane Branch, where the branch president, managers, and local staff explained the bank's role in RMB internationalization and its contribution to the development of Southeast Asian countries like Laos.

BOC X CEM e-Bill & Autopay Service Special Offer, to receive rebate up to MOP100
From today until 31 December 2025, customers who meet the specified requirements during the promotion period can enjoy the following benefits:
 MOP 50 rebate on electricity bill (New CEM e-Bill registration with at least 3 consecutive months of usage)
 Entry into a monthly lucky draw (New BOC auto-pay registration)
 MOP 50 BOC coupon (New BOC auto-pay registration + active CEM e-Bill (including new sign-ups during the promotion or existing customers registered before 16 June 2025)
How to apply:
1. CEM e-Bill: Click the following link to the online application form 
https://e-service.cem-macau.com/en/e-bill-application
2. Autopay Service: You can apply at the counters of CEM customer service centres or BOC banks, or via the QR code in the website
For more 
 https://www.cem-macau.com/en/event/57
Notes: This Promotion is only applicable to CEM e-Bill subscribers and new applicants of BOC autopay service for electricity bill payment.

The fourth edition of HKGCCâ€™s Pitch Perfect Programme has officially launched today! 
 
Initiated by the Young Executives Club in 2011 and supported by the Home and Youth Affairs Bureau, this comprehensive training programme and competition targets undergraduates from universities and community colleges across Hong Kong. 
 
This year, over 140 students have enrolled, with nearly 50 Chamber members signing up as mentors. The objective is to equip students with essential career skills and foster connections between the business community and youth. The programme consists of four stages: training, mentorship, company visits and pitching. 
 
A huge thank you to our corporate sponsors this year: Bank of China (Hong Kong), EY, Nan Fung Group â€“ Airside, MTR Corporation Limited, Shun Tak Holdings Ltd and Sino Group, and our corporate partner, NEC Hong Kong. Together, we are shaping the future!
